thread.title: Local baseball coach Dave Wheeler passes away following fight with cancer -
thread.title_full: Local baseball coach Dave Wheeler passes away following fight with cancer - Orlando Sentinel

author: orlandosentinel.com
title: Local baseball coach Dave Wheeler passes away following fight with cancer -
text:
Dave Wheeler coached until the chemotherapy was too much for his body to withstand.
Less than three weeks later, the Central Florida baseball community lost a friend and mentor.
Wheeler, 60, died early Thursday morning following a brief battle with colon, liver and lung cancer .
He was in his sixth season as head coach at Freedom High School after spending 17 years at Bishop Moore, where he led the Hornets to a state title in 2007.
“You don’t hang around a guy like Dave Wheeler and not feel the impact,” Freedom athletic director Roy Peters said. “He was a positive impact on lots and lots of kids.”
Such an impact stretched far beyond the baseball diamond.
Peters said students passed around poster boards in the hallways at Freedom, signing messages offering condolences and honoring the beloved coach.
An open-casket viewing will be held Friday, March 10, at 6 p.m. at Church on the Drive, located at 1914 Edgewater Dr. in Orlando. The closed-casket service will be held March 11 at 2 p.m.
Wheeler, a UCF graduate, also spent time as an assistant coach at Colonial, Edgewater and Boone. He served as a dean of students at Bishop Moore while overseeing its baseball program from 1994-2010.
Bishop Moore coach Tony Mehlich, who played for Wheeler from 2000-03, said students considered him a friend and that fellow coaches respected his knowledge and approach to the game.
“He got the best out of every kid, whether you were the last one on the bench or the star on the team,” Mehlich said. “His passion for the game left an impact on all of my teammates.”
Bishop Moore held a moment of silence for Wheeler on Thursday during the dedication of its newly refurbished field, named in memory of Joe Skinner.
Skinner, then a 17-year old senior, died last April in Dallas while awaiting a procedure to fight off leukemia.
Wheeler’s son, Matt, is a junior on Edgewater’s varsity baseball team and was a former Bishop Moore bat boy during Mehlich’s playing days. Matt Wheeler was invited into the Hornets’ dugout for their game following the ceremony.
Bishop Moore will pay its respects to Dave Wheeler once more on March 31 when they celebrate the anniversaries of the 1977 and 2007 state title teams.
“He built an awesome tradition here that we still try to keep intact,” Mehlich said. “Everything that I run here has kind of kept the tradition of what Coach Wheeler was about.”
